name: Aws caching overview
description: In computing, a cache is a high-speed data storage layer that stores a subset of data. It's typically transient in nature so that future requests for said data are served up faster than is possible, which then accesses the dataâ€™s primary storage location. Caching also allows developers to efficiently reuse previously retrieved or computed data.

name: Redis
description: Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store that can be used as a cache, message broker, and more.

name: Memcached
description: Memcached is a high-performance, distributed memory object caching system. It's commonly used to speed up dynamic database-driven websites.

name: Varnish Cache
description: Varnish Cache is a powerful open-source HTTP accelerator and caching reverse proxy that significantly improves website performance.

name: NGINX Caching
description: NGINX is a popular web server that can also be used as a reverse proxy and caching solution, enhancing website performance.

name: Cloudflare CDN
description: Cloudflare is a content delivery network that offers caching, DDoS protection, and other performance-enhancing features.

name: cache-content: Improve App performance
description: An article that explains caching fundamentals, caching types, and how caching improves performance.
